Description: Fragments of weft faced wool cloth, a cushion-cover (?), with bands, some of them shaded, and the remains of two seams. Colours: plain bands in purple-coloured wool, 3.3 to 4.5cm deep; shaded bands from dark green, through light green, through yellow wool to undyed cotton, then yellow through pink to dark red wool - where complete 5.5cm deep.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), House 138 (south) level 1 house 139 (south) level 1 temple 1100 room 2 level 1 pit 1137 level 1
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
